intro: Hieracium baldaccii, commonly known as the Baldaccii hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in alpine and subalpine habitats, where it thrives in well-drained, rocky soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow with a central disc. Hieracium baldaccii is often found in open meadows and is adapted to the harsh conditions of high-altitude environments.
